title: Great!
comment: Does exactly what it says. Clear and simple to use. Great work!

title: Can be better
comment: A lot of steps to import, The desktop version is very nice.....

I'm sorry you're not happy with Mnemododo. Synchronisation is sometimes a bit tricky to configure at first, but after that it normally works smoothly.
I have sent you a full refund, but do not hesitate to mail me privately (tim@tbrk.org) if you still want to try to get synchronisation working.

title: What a great app!
comment: Thanks for such great useful app! I'm a huge fan of  Mnemosyne. I've been using it since 2011. It's user-friendly, and it helps me a lot with my studies.  Mr. Tim, I wonder if you could possibly make cards EDITABLE on the phone. It's easy to correct a mistake on the spot.  Once again, thank you very much for your wonderful app.

Thank you!
Regrettably, Mnemogogo/dodo was not designed to handle editing.
You can, however, mark cards for later editing in Mnemosyne, see: http://www.tbrk.org/software/mnemododo.html#features.
This has the advantage of separating reviewing (most important) from editing (less important).

title: Great adjunct
comment: Excellent adjunct to mnemosyne. Allows me to work on my massive list of flash cards wherever I am. It does need improvement in several areas (i.e picture scaling, transfer of files), but it does the basics.

title: Never leave home without it
comment: I am learning Russian, and I use any spare moments I have to open the app and continue my scheduled cards. Easy-to-use.  Perfect for all learners which should include everyone.

title: Best flashcards
comment: This is awesome. I love it. I am so grateful!

title: Skvělý
comment: Na slovíčka, ale i na další věci, který je potřeba si jednou za čas zopakovat

Had an issue with this app on my atrix so i emailed the dev. within 24 hours I had a reply! With the atrix, you need to wait 5 minutes	in the settings menu (until it responds) then select restrict directory search. Type /sdcard-ext then follow the prompts on the initial screen.

title: Learning Japanese...
comment: ...is awesome, using this software.

title: don't like
comment: love it
Omg I love this! Absolute best tool ever BY FAR for learning a new language! Took me a day to figure it out but was well worth it... Thanks so much!!

title: Fabulous, life-changing
comment: If you use flashcards extensively, this app is life-changing. Being able to review flashcards on the go means that you are no longer chained to the computer during daily review, can fill empty minutes of the day (waiting for the train, say) with reviewing, and improve learning by varying the environment (a key principle of learning is to practice in different environments). This elegant and simple app does just that. If you use flashcards (esp. for language learning), this is the best money you’ll spend.
Atrix requires user to set path to /sdcard-ext or app will get stuck in endless loop. Other than that, great app!
Would like edit functionality on phone
Great app, but wouldn't work on my Galaxy S without an external SD card. Ability to add, delete and edit would be a great addition.
Great addition to pc program My most used app
Add / edit function would make life easier on the go. Very functional app, though. Thanks!
Ability to add/edit cards, plus better control of how to schedule unlearned cards would make this worth $20 or more to me.great as is though.
Excellent GPLed app for Mnemosyne users. Mac setup requires handpatching Mnemosyne, unfortunately, and sync is cumbersome. But I love it!
The best I've used so far. Tried Full Recall, Flash Brain, SuperMemo, Quizlet, and more. Mnemosyne combined with Mnemododo has the right balance.
Pretty cool. I expect to use this often.
